title: Slayer task/Hellhounds

properties.name: description
properties.value: Hellhounds can be assigned as a slayer task at 75 combat level by various slayer masters. They can be found in a variety of locations around Gielinor. The task is very straightforward as regular hellhounds only attack with their fairly accurate melee bites; it is recommended to either safespot them or keep Protect from Melee on at all times. Hellhounds have the chance of dropping a Smouldering stone and Hard clues.

Icon IDNo

Hellhounds can be assigned as a slayer task at 75 combat level by various slayer masters. They can be found in a variety of locations around Gielinor. The task is very straightforward as regular hellhounds only attack with their fairly accurate melee bites; it is recommended to either safespot them or keep Protect from Melee on at all times. Hellhounds have the chance of dropping a Smouldering stone and Hard clues.

One fast way to complete a Hellhound Slayer task is with a Dwarf multicannon in the Stronghold Slayer Dungeon, as it has a fair amount of hellhounds, allows the player to place a cannon and has many safespots to stand in. Killing Hellhounds in the Catacombs of Kourend gives access to the bonus drop table of Ancient shards and Dark totem pieces.

While slaying in the Wilderness, an imbued ring of wealth can be worn to increase the droprate of hard clue scrolls from 1/64 to 1/32, making it one of the fastest methods of getting hard clue scrolls in the game. The Edgeville teleport lever is a quick way to travel back and forth from the Deserted Keep. Note that Revenant Hellhounds do not count towards a Hellhound slayer task. Keep in mind that Wilderness is a dangerous area, so it is recommended to only bring items you are willing to lose.

Cerberus and skeletal hellhounds can be killed as alternatives to normal hellhounds. The former can provide significant profit over normal hellhounds, but requires 91 Slayer (boostable) in order to be fought, while the latter is highly discouraged due to being summoned by another boss, Vet'ion, whose location is a hotspot for player killing.

Monster Variants[edit | edit source]

Monster Combat level Slayer XP Locations Notes
Hellhound 122 116
  • Catacombs of Kourend
  • East of Deserted Keep
  • Karuulm Slayer Dungeon
  • Stronghold Slayer Dungeon
  • Taverley Dungeon
  • Witchaven Dungeon
  • Standard Hellhounds, found in various locations around Gielinor.
Hellhound 127 116
  • God Wars Dungeon
  • Stronger Hellhounds found only in the God Wars Dungeon. Killing them contributes to Zamorak Kill count.
Hellhound 136 150
  • Wilderness Slayer Cave
  • Stronger Hellhounds found only in the Wilderness Slayer Cave.
Skeleton Hellhound 214 114.5
  • Vet'ion
  • Two are summoned midway through Vet'ion's first phase. They must be defeated to continue the fight.
  • For more information on fighting Vet'ion, see Vet'ion/Strategies.
Greater Skeleton Hellhound 281 214.5
  • Vet'ion
  • Two are summoned midway through Vet'ion's second phase. They must be defeated to continue the fight.
  • For more information on fighting Vet'ion, see Vet'ion/Strategies.
Cerberus 318 690
  • Cerberus' Lair
  • Boss variant, requires 91 to be fought.
  • For more information on killing Cerberus, see Cerberus/Strategies.

Location Comparison[edit | edit source]

Location Maplink Amount Multicombat Cannonable Safespottable Notes
Catacombs of Kourend Maplink 9 Yes No Yes
  • Killing Hellhounds here also gives access to Ancient shards and Dark totem pieces as bonus drops.
God Wars Dungeon Maplink 5 Yes No Yes
  • Hellhounds are considered Zamorak followers.
  • It is recommended to wear God-aligned items to avoid getting attacked by multiple monsters.
  • Highly discouraged due to generally far and sparse spawns.
Karuulm Slayer Dungeon Maplink 12 No Yes Yes
  • Players who haven't completed the Elite Kourend & Kebos Diary must wear the boots of stone, boots of brimstone or granite boots to protect themselves from the extreme heat of the dungeon floor.
Stronghold Slayer Dungeon Maplink 13 No Yes Yes
Taverley Dungeon Maplink 13 No Yes Yes
  • 80 Agility (boostable at 75 with summer pie) is highly recommended.
Witchaven Dungeon Maplink 8 No Yes Yes
  • Long distance from a bank or convenient teleport makes it less recommended than other dungeons.
  • A short puzzle is required to access the Hellhounds area for the first time.
Wilderness (Level 49-55), near the Resource Area Maplink 6 No Yes Yes
  • High danger of Player killing due to high traffic and high Wilderness level
  • Lever provides easy access to the Edgeville bank.
Wilderness (Level 18-22), Wilderness Slayer Cave Maplink 5 Yes Yes Yes
  • Multicombat area and high Risk Player Killing in the area makes this a very dangerous location.
Wilderness (Level 31-35), near Vet'ion N/A 4 Yes Yes No
  • Vet'ion summons two Skeleton Hellhounds and two Greater Skeleton Hellhounds during the fight.
  • Highly discouraged due to area being common hotspot for player killing and they have no drops other than the looting bag.

Exceptions[edit | edit source]

  • Revenant hellhounds cannot be slain for a Hellhound Slayer task. They can only be slain for a Revenant Slayer task, which can be assigned by Krystilia.
  • The Skeleton Hellhound fought during the In Search of the Myreque quest counts towards a Hellhound Slayer task during the quest. However, refighting it in the Nightmare Zone later on does not count towards a task.
  • Bouncer fought during the Fight Arena quest counts towards a Hellhound Slayer task during the quest. However, refighting it in the Nightmare Zone later on does not count towards a task.
  • Bouncer's ghost fought during The General's Shadow miniquest does not count toward Hellhound Slayer tasks. Regardless, it cannot be fought after the completion of the miniquest.

[[Hellhound]]s can be assigned as a [[slayer task]] at 75 combat level by various [[slayer masters]]. They can be found in a variety of locations around Gielinor. The task is very straightforward as regular hellhounds only attack with their fairly accurate [[melee]] bites; it is recommended to either [[safespot]] them or keep [[Protect from Melee]] on at all times. Hellhounds have the chance of dropping a [[Smouldering stone]] and [[Hard clue]]s. 

One fast way to complete a Hellhound [[Slayer task]] is with a [[Dwarf multicannon]] in the [[Stronghold Slayer Dungeon]], as it has a fair amount of hellhounds, allows the player to place a cannon and has many safespots to stand in. Killing Hellhounds in the Catacombs of Kourend gives access to the bonus drop table of [[Ancient shard]]s and [[Dark totem]] pieces.

While slaying in the [[Wilderness]], an [[Ring of wealth (i)|imbued ring of wealth]] can be worn to increase the droprate of [[Clue scroll (hard)|hard clue scrolls]] from 1/64 to 1/32, making it one of the fastest methods of getting hard clue scrolls in the game. The [[Lever (Edgeville)|Edgeville teleport lever]] is a quick way to travel back and forth from the [[Deserted Keep]]. Note that Revenant Hellhounds do not count towards a Hellhound slayer task. Keep in mind that Wilderness is a dangerous area, so it is recommended to only bring items you are willing to lose.

[[Cerberus]] and skeletal hellhounds can be killed as alternatives to normal hellhounds. The former can provide significant profit over normal hellhounds, but requires 91 [[Slayer]] (boostable) in order to be fought, while the latter is highly discouraged due to being summoned by another boss, [[Vet'ion]], whose location is a hotspot for [[player killing]].

==Exceptions==
*[[Revenant hellhound]]s cannot be slain for a Hellhound Slayer task. They can only be slain for a [[Revenants|Revenant]] Slayer task, which can be assigned by [[Krystilia]].
*The [[Skeleton Hellhound]] fought during the [[In Search of the Myreque]] [[quest]] counts towards a Hellhound Slayer task during the quest. However, refighting it in the [[Nightmare Zone]] later on does not count towards a task.
*[[Bouncer]] fought during the [[Fight Arena]] [[quest]] counts towards a Hellhound Slayer task during the quest. However, refighting it in the [[Nightmare Zone]] later on does not count towards a task.
*[[Bouncer (ghost)|Bouncer's ghost]] fought during [[The General's Shadow]] [[miniquest]] does not count toward Hellhound Slayer tasks. Regardless, it cannot be fought after the completion of the miniquest.
